definition: a row/a line/to set in order/to arrange/to line up/to eliminate/to drain/to push open/platoon/raft/classifier for lines, rows etc
to resist/to obstruct/to hinder/to keep off/to block (a blow)/to get in the way of/cover/gear (e.g. in a car's transmission)

sentences.english: Remove bolts holding shift lever to transmission.
sentences.chinese: 拆卸將排擋杆固定到變速箱的螺栓。

sentences.english: This helps simulate changing gears when you run up a hill during a race.
sentences.chinese: 這是模擬您在比賽過程中登上坡頂之時“更換排擋”。

sentences.english: It's like shifting gears too quickly in a car.
sentences.chinese: 這好比汽車的排擋切換過快。

sentences.english: You haven't got the feel of the gears in this car yet.
sentences.chinese: 你對這輛汽車的排擋還不熟悉。

sentences.english: Leave a car in neutral gear.
sentences.chinese: 讓汽車排擋置於空擋位置。

sentences.english: Have you tried the food from the little corner-store before?
sentences.chinese: 你去拐角那家大排擋喫過嗎？
如果可能的話，自動排擋的。

sentences.english: Gears on an automobile may be used either to decrease or increase speed.
sentences.chinese: 汽車的排擋可用來加速或減速。

sentences.english: Party and alcohol are the ultimate duo to spice up a night.
sentences.chinese: 聚會和酒精是讓夜晚活色生香的絕佳排擋。

sentences.english: Reverse and Park, meanwhile, are engaged using the shift lever knob on the centre console.
sentences.chinese: 反向和公園，同時，從事使用中控臺上的排擋頭。

sentences.english: Share your big-race goals with training partners.
sentences.chinese: 與訓練排擋一起分享您的大賽目標。

sentences.english: Citygoers drink and eat into the night at one of Tokyo's many underground food stalls in 2009.
sentences.chinese: 市民們晚間在東京許多的地下大排擋中用餐飲酒。

sentences.english: My dear friends, do you think the snack stalls should be kept or abandoned?
sentences.chinese: 親愛的友友，你覺得大排擋究竟是留還是存？

sentences.english: The kiosks all look alike to us and the dishes bewildering.
sentences.chinese: 這些排擋看上去差不多，碟子熱讓人困惑。

definition: to eat out/to eat at a restaurant
Yancheng district of Kaohsiung city 高雄市[Gao1 xiong2 shi4], south Taiwan
imagawayaki (sweet snack made of batter cooked in the shape of a car wheel, stuffed with azuki bean paste or other fillings)
Xinshi District of Ürümqi, Xinjiang/Sinshih District of Tainan, Taiwan
fried chicken pieces with salt and pepper/Taiwan-style fried chicken
the whole nest came out (idiom); to turn out in full strength
